questions.text: What is the clearance of substance X, if X is freely filtrated, there is no reabsorption and in addition to the filtrated amount, the same amount is secreted by the tubular system? (GFR= 120 ml/min) (S)

metadata.matchReason: Clearance = GFR + secretion = 120 + 120 = 240 ml/min - Topic 47: Tubular secretion

questions.text: The forces included in the Starling-equilibrium act as follows: (M)

options.text: interstitial hydrostatic pressure promotes filtration or absorption depending whether it is positive or negative
intracapillary colloid osmotic pressure promotes filtration
interstitial colloid osmotic pressure promotes absorption

metadata.matchReason: Starling forces: Pc promotes filtration, Pi varies - Topic 39: Capillaries, transcapillary exchange

questions.text: It is characteristic of renal glucose handling under normal, physiological conditions that: (M)

options.text: the clearance for glucose is 120 ml/min
the clearance for glucose is zero

glucose transport is linked to protein reabsorption

glucose is freely filtered in the glomeruli

metadata.matchReason: Glucose freely filtered, completely reabsorbed (clearance=0) - Topic 46: Tubular reabsorption

questions.text: At which plasma glucose concentration does the glucose appear in the urine (renal threshold)? (S)
